Description: Stamp (vessel): qisṭ. Measure of honey. With four line Kufic inscription and a 6 pointed star at the end of the legend. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: The only other type of stamp for honey that has been published is the qisṭ of Ḥayyān b. Shurayḥ, represented by two specimens from the same die (Miles 1958, 13; 1971, 5). Bibliography: Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York; Miles, G.C. 1971. ‘Umayyad and ʿAbbasid glass weights and measure stamps in the Corning Museum’. Corning.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (14)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Usāma b. Zayd
